column1: a dart to start, flat and quick on leg. Beats Roy's pull. A big appeal as ball hits pad, sliding down
flat and quick, keeps going on, defended back to the bowler
too flat again, short. Roy gets bat on his pull this time, finds the gap in front of square, four. Midwicket runs around but has no chance
flat outside off, swatted to mid-on for one. Watson was labouring towards the striker's end.
overpitched outside off, Watson drills a drive to cover
flat and quick again, pushed through, hit away to mid-off
on the pads, nudged down to short fine leg. Gets away with that, should have been four.
a tad straight again, worked to deep square leg for a run
on middle and leg, pushed with soft hands towards mid-on for one.
a wild heave! Full on middle and leg, Roy swings and the bounce takes the ball over the bat and middle stump
back of a length on middle, a good comeback from Sami in terms of line, played to backward point
too straight again, picked off for four. On the pads, Roy gets a bit of bat on his flick, races away down to the fine leg boundary
quick down leg, Watson is also hurried on a pull. Played away to square leg
very full around off, smashed back to the bowler
another wild one. Full on leg, Roy clears his front leg and inside-edges one to square leg. Looking to hit the ball too hard
slightly slower, Watson picks the length, rocks back and nails his pull over midwicket. So easy.
picks out long-on! Flat and quick, Watson goes back and looks to pull again, but is slightly hurried on the pull. The timing is awry, the placement is not good and Watson goes.
full around off, pushed to long-on
full and wide, the ball angling away, takes the outside edge down to third man for a run.
drifts down leg again does Sami. Roy again misses out on runs, off the pad towards the keeper
smashed for four. A slower ball outside off, Roy runs down, picks the variation and smashes the ball through wide mid-off.
strays down leg, wide.
full, straight and quick. Roy is beaten on the flick. Struck on the pad, Sami goes up in appeal. Asks Ronchi if they should review, he suggests the ball is going down leg.
hit around the midriff now. Short around middle and leg, Roy beaten on the pull, the ball hits him on the body.
another ill-directed delivery, straying down leg, off the pad towards fine leg
full down leg, shovelled towards wide mid-on for one.
short and wide this time, slashed away down to third man for a run.
full and straight, pushed to mid-on from the crease
full and quick, the yorker, straight. Worked away towards short fine leg. Roy has just struggled to suss out conditions here.
just short of the bowler! Full and straight, Roy looks to shovel one into the leg side, but the ball flies off the inside edge into the pad then back towards the bowler. Falls just short.
around off, opens the bat face does Roy to guide the ball to backward point
a thick outside edge down to third man. Butt getting a hint of lateral movement on that, had it going away from the outside edge

Roy's stumbling innings ends. A real struggle. Absurd because there are seaming, not spinning, conditions. A length delivery outside off, moves back in after pitching, hurries Roy for pace, the ball creeps past the under edge and hit off stump.
just short of extra cover! Full and wide, Pietersen nails his drive but it doesn't quite carry to the fielder, diving forward.
a fine stroke. Full outside off, Pietersen offers the full face, driven towards mid-off
a length delivery outside off, moving away, off the outside edge down to third man again.
superb from KP! Overpitched around off, flicked away nonchalantly through midwicket. The timing is terrific.
overpitched outside off, drilled down to long-off for a run.
overpitched and wide outside off, hit away to mid-off for a run.
full outside off, the ball takes the outside half towards the sweeper cover.
a full delivery outside off, the ball comes back in, off the inside edge into the pad and then towards point
overpitched again, driven sweetly to long-off for one

Pietersen now perishes. A full delivery outside off, Pietersen runs down, looking for his typical drag-flick into the leg side but the ball is just too far wide outside off. Takes the inside edge and an easy catch for the keeper.
nice and full from Butt, driven to mid-off
a yorker outside off, jammed away towards cover for one
full and wide, too wide, and called
full outside off, the ball moves away and beats the bat. He's getting just enough movement.
back of a length on middle and leg, pushed to mid-on for a run
a full delivery outside off, chipped away to long-on
good length delivery outside off, punched up towards long-off for another single
overpitched and wide outside off, jammed out towards third man for a single
full and wide, the ball moving away, driven away towards mid-on
a short delivery down leg, pulled away towards fine leg for one. Hurried for pace again
a yorker outside off, punched up towards long-off for one
smashed on the helmet! A short delivery around off, Sarfraz is very late on the shot. He tries to bail out but the ball hits the helmet and flies down to the third man boundary. Four head byes.
shortish and wide, chopped down to third man for one
flat around off, Sarfraz backs away and carves a cut to point
short around off, pulled away to deep midwicket
a googly outside off, punched away to long-on for one
slow on the pads, worked away to deep square leg. Just the one.
a low full toss around off, smashed away towards the bowler. Parried to long-on
a low full toss, looking to fire it in. Drilled down towards long-on, who gets across to his left
smashed away over midwicket. A length delivery around off, Sarfraz clears his front leg and swats the ball over midwicket for six.
a fullish delivery outside off, pushed towards wide mid-on for a couple. Very well played, right into the gap for two
a full delivery outside off, carved down to third man for a run
on middle and leg, worked away to deep square leg, one more.
fantastic batting from Sarfraz. Backs away, the bowler doesn't want to bowl in his area, so it's short and wide. Carved away over backward point for four.
short, around middle and leg, Sarfraz backs away. This time, the bowler does err in his area and he's put away over midwicket for four. Sensational batting.
well bowled, well played. Sees the batsman coming so he fires it very wide outside off. But the batsman reaches out and drives to long-off
flat outside off, quick, chopped away down to short third man for one.
flat down leg, Amin misses a sweep, struck on the pad. 17 off 19 now
the googly, short and wide, cut to point. Another dot.
a low full toss around off, swatted away to deep midwicket for one
flat around off, chopped down to short third man
back of a length on middle and leg, nudged down to fine leg

caught and dropped on the long-off boundary! Full and wide, Amin just extends his lofted drive. Gets amazing timing behind it, Samit runs to his right, gets a hand on it but as he makes contact with the boundary, the ball pops out.
full and straight, worked to deep midwicket for one
full around middle and leg, chipped down to long-on for one more
on a length, worked to deep midwicket
short and down leg, clipped to square leg for one
full and flat down leg, shovelled away to deep backward square leg for one
flat around middle, pushed through, darted in. Swatted away to long-on for one
may have been the googly, very wide outside off, swatted to long-on for one
carted away over midwicket. He knows exactly what's happening. Charges down at this, gets to the pitch and hoicks the ball over midwicket. Too good from Sarfraz
flat and wide outside off, Sarfraz gives himself room and drills the drive to the sweeper cover
Sarfraz backs away, Amad follows the batsman and hits him on the pad. But one leg bye.

taken by Hales at the long-off boundary! Full and wide outside off, Amin backs away and looks to hit the ball over cover but can't get enough timing behind it. The ball skews off the outside half to the fielder
a no-ball, and four. The ball slips out and is well over waist height by the time Sarfraz flicks the ball to the boundary behind square on the leg side
a good low full toss outside off, Sarfraz misses a big drive. A cry of anguish as the ball misses bat.
a yorker down leg, Sarfraz misses the flick, struck on the pad
back of a length outside off, punched to long-on
full outside off, the ball continues to move away and beat the bat.

misses a full toss does Sarfraz. He backs away, opening up the off side, but the bowler may have been looking for the yorker and gets it very wrong. Sarfraz may have been taken aback by that level of misdirection, the ball beats him for pace and hits off and middle stump
full outside off, punched away to the deep point fielder
full and wide outside off, sliced off the open face, past backward point and four. Played very late.
full and wide, the ball moves away and beats the bat.
full and wide outside off, sliced off the open face to deep point for a run. Tidy over for Islamabad.

chips his wicket away to mid-off. A full delivery outside off, Anwar Ali drives on the up but finds Duminy at mid-off. A tame shot, a soft dismissal. He didn't go through with the shot nor did he keep it down
full and straight, flicked to midwicket
good length around middle and leg, nudged away to deep square leg
on the pads, cramping Rossouw for room, he can't get bat on his flick, the ball pings off towards fine leg
drifts down leg, wide.

and another batsman chipping his wicket away. On a length around middle and leg, Nawaz backs away and drives on the up. But his timing isn't great, nor is his placement. Right down the throat of Duminy at long-on
full around off, Hassan drives that to long-on.
full delivery outside off, the ball trickles to third man via the outside edge
full and wide outside off, carved away to the sweeper cover for one
full and straight, bunted away to long-on. Quetta losing the little momentum they had gained earlier
back of a length on leg, Rossouw can't connect with a swipe. The ball makes contact with his body
full and wide outside off, swatted down to mid-off. Rossouw sends Hassan back
full outside off, chopped away towards cover
in the slot and it's outta here. Full and wide, with mid-off up, and Rossouw says thanks with a nicely chipped lofted drive over mid-off.
back of a length, shortish, on the hips. Rossouw pulls awkwardly towards deep midwicket, falls short, one.
on middle and leg, worked away to deep square leg for one.
a short slower one down leg, Rossouw is beaten on his pull, the ball goes through to the keeper
looking for a reverse paddle sweep. Short outside off, Rossouw anticipated the wide yorker so stayed low, but it was short. So he can't make contact
swatted away to deep midwicket, just one. On a length around middle, can't get adequate timing behind the shot.
full around off, inside-edged back towards Sami in his follow-through who sloppily lets it go through. Not a bad result for Sami though
a short delivery on middle, Hassan backs away and looks to drive, but fails to connect
back of a length around off, pushed away to wide long-on. Rossouw comes back for two. They need every run they can muster
smashed for six. A full and wide delivery outside off, Hassan comes charging and drills a flat six over cover. Lots of power behind the stroke.
full and wide outside off, smashed away towards the deep cover fielder. Rossouw doesn't want the strike, happy to come back for two.
back of a length on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on. Will just be one.
starts off with a shortish wide, well down the leg side
down the track to a slowish off-stump ball, driven straight back to the bowler
on the pads, clipped quietly through square leg
length ball close to off stump, punched into the covers
fullish on off stump, not quite driving length and he goes hard at it and the bowler drops a tough return catch, low to his left in his follow-through. It was only inches above the ground
back of a length, fired in flat on off stump. No room to force this, just plays a defensive punch into the point region
length ball angling into middle stump, no turn, driven inside-out to cover point. An excellent first over, could have been even better had he clung onto that chance
back of a length, angling down leg. Looks to flick it away, only manages a tickle of pad to the right of the keeper. Maybe an inside edge too
drops just a touch short, on off stump, and Ronchi is so quickly into position - shades of Ricky Ponting there - to pull flat and hard to the left of deep square leg

another short one, this one's dug in with more effort and is angled slightly further across. Ronchi looks to pull again, goes hard at it, and gets a thick top edge that flies all the way over the fine third man boundary
shortish, lots of width, but it doesn't quite bounce as expected, sneaks under Ronchi's attempted slash
lovely delivery, back of a length, slanting across the stumps, and nips away slightly to beat Ronchi's bat as he tries to open his face and run it down to third man
got him! Back of a length, once again he cuts down the width, and Ronchi, trying that dab to third man once again, only manages a bottom-edge into his stumps
flat, angling across towards middle and off, clipped back to the bowler
shortish on leg stump, and Duminy puts it away with ease, opens his front hip and swats it away high over square leg

down the track now and he skips away from the line of this off-stump ball to create extra swinging room. Uses it very well to drive smoothly between the diving bowler and the non-striker. Mid-off had no chance there
back of a length, angling into the body, defended back to the bowler

down the track again but this time he gets nowhere near the pitch. Held the length back cleverly there, and the ball doesn't turn. Ends up playing slightly across the line while looking to play for turn, and gets a thick outside edge that runs away to the third man boundary
a step out of his crease once more and Nawaz sends down a length ball on off and middle. Clipped away through square leg
back of a length outside off, opens his bat face to steer it down to third man
length ball slanting across to off stump, driven crisply to the left of mid-off
short, rising to around shoulder height around off stump, and Duminy is on it in a flash, superb bat speed to pull that away to the right of the square-leg umpire
back of a length close to off stump, shuffles across and defends into the on side
back of a length close to off stump, squeezed away to third man, past the fielder sprinting to his right from backward point and sliding
full, just a bit of width outside off, and Hales puts it away with a powerful drive through extra-cover
length ball outside off, carved to backward point off the front foot
on the pads now, clipped away towards deep square leg
back of a length, at the body, tucked off the hip to fine leg
on the pads once more - he's struggling with his line here - and that's a bad ball with fine leg in the circle. Clipped away easily to the left of that fielder
back of a length on off and middle, defended to midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched to cover point

ooh, not quite full enough for the drive, or maybe Hales simply didn't get his head down over the ball. The drive pops up in the air, but over extra-cover and drops safely before any deep fielder can get to it
back of a length, goes with the arm towards off stump, jabbed down into the point region
full now, almost in the blockhole, too full to swing away through midwicket. Thick inside edge rolls to short fine leg
full on middle and off, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length, angling into middle and leg, tucked away to deep midwicket
length ball on off stump, defended towards mid-off
fullish on off and middle, driven to long-on
back of a length on off stump, pushed towards mid-off for the quick single
back of a length close to off stump, chopped away to the left of backward point
length ball on off stump, punched to short extra-cover
width, plenty of it. It's not a bad length but the line is woeful, and he simply frees his arms to slice it away over point

gone! That's quite an astonishing shot, actually - not a short ball at all, it was probably heading for the top of off or middle stump, and he simply whips it with the inward angle, hard and flat, times it beautifully, but straight into the hands of the fielder at long leg
length ball angling into middle stump, driven towards long-on
loopy low full-toss, driven hard to the right of sweeper cover
back of a length on off stump, punched down to long-on
shot! Long-off is wide, and Shadab hammers an airy drive into the big gap to the fielder's right after Hasan serves one up right in the slot, full and just outside off

ha! The fielder at long-off, Roy, had moved straighter after that previous shot, and this time he gets a flatter full one on off stump, which he drills flat, with some wristwork to hit it inside-out, to the fielder's left, forces him into a sliding stop
full again, driven down to long-off
back of a length, angling into off stump, punched down the ground to long-on
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
once again, back of a length and just outside off, punched to backward point
length ball angling into middle stump from wide of the crease. Stays on the back foot to defend back towards the bowler

stops on him slightly - similar ball to the previous one, slanting into middle stump. Wants to whip it through midwicket, and is through his shot too early, gets a leading edge that pops up momentarily but falls well short of extra-cover
starts with a friendly one on the pads, tucked away to long leg
back of a length on middle stump, clipped away to the right of midwicket
length ball slanting away from off stump, opens his bat face to steer it down to third man
short slower one outside off, launches himself through the cut too early and the ball bounces loopily into the keeper's gloves
another slower one, slanted into the pads. Plays the flick too early and misses

another short one wide of off, but this is the regular-pace ball, and it sits up nicely for Shadab to slap away, in the air, hard and flat over point. Poor way to finish what was otherwise a pretty decent over
back of a length, angling across the left-hander, opens his bat face and steers it through point
poor ball, back of a length and angling into Shadab's legs, tucked away neatly to the fine leg boundary
fullish outside off, drives to cover with left elbow nice and high
slower ball close to off stump, stays back and opens his bat face to dab to backward point
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
length ball close to off stump, comes forward, waits, and plays extremely late to drop the ball gently into the off side, but the man at point charges in to deny him the single
back of a length, angling into middle stump. Stops on him slightly as he tries to flick and Shadab sends a leading edge rolling into the covers
fullish on off stump, punched to the left of mid-off
fullish, angling away from off stump, driven firmly to extra-cover
length ball on middle and leg, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump, punched to sweeper cover

bowled him! Shadab wanted to hang back and steer this one to third man, and ends up playing slightly inside the line. It's just a straight ball angled into the top of off stump, and he plays it with half a bat. He misses, and Watson hits
back of a length, neither short nor wide enough to cut, sneaks below his bat
slower ball on the pads, pitching outside leg, doesn't quite pick it and misses the flick
fullish on middle stump, clipped to the right of the diving midwicket fielder, towards long-on
shot! What a way to start. Not too bad a ball, fullish on middle and off, and he makes himself room and flays it away, a powerful drive to the right of the diving extra-cover fielder
fullish again, slanting away from off stump. Doesn't quite come on, keeps a bit low as well, and he overbalances while driving and can't connect
slower length ball on middle stump. Stays slightly leg-side of the ball to squeeze it towards backward point
back of a length on off stump, punched to deep point
slower ball, back of a length and angling away from off stump. Looks to make a bit of room and dab to third man, can't connect
fullish on middle and off, eases a drive towards mid-off and starts running as he plays the shot
short one down the leg side, and Duminy misses out on a scoring opportunity. Looks to pull, only manages a bit of glove on it and it bounces down towards the keeper
down the track now to the off-stump ball, slices it away in the air, on the bounce, to the right of the sweeper on the cover boundary. Anwar Ali misfields but quickly makes amends
length ball on middle stump, whipped into the on side, to the right of midwicket

full on the pads, and that could be a psychologically deflating hit for Quetta. Flicks it away, high and handsome, waaay beyond the square leg boundary and over the roof, to bring up a beautifully controlled half-century
short, angling away from off stump and providing lots of width, slashed hard but too close to backward point to get any runs for it
slower length ball wide of off, opens his bat face to stab towards backward point
down the track. Anwar sees him coming and fires it wide of off stump. Reaches out to squeeze a single into the covers
full on middle and leg, and he makes himself lots of room and extends his arms through a big drive that carries all the way over the long-off boundary
length ball on off stump, makes room again and slaps it to the left of sweeper cover
short on off stump, pulled along the ground to the right of deep square leg

slower ball a long way down the leg side. Perhaps a sign of Watson's struggle with the dew. He saw Talat make a premeditated move across his stumps, and may have wanted to target leg stump, but ended up missing by a long way
bang! That is another huge hit. Again, as he does so often, he makes himself swinging room by moving towards the leg side, and a middle-stump ball is whipped way over the midwicket boundary
fires in a wide yorker, reaches out to try and stab it towards point, and misses. The umpire reckons this is wide enough to be a wide - it was pretty tight with the tramline
and again. Another wide yorker ends up sliding too wide. This one's an easier decision for the umpire to make
shortish on off stump, rises to his toes and dabs gently to the right of backward point
length ball on middle stump, makes a bit of room to enable a pushed single into the covers
full on off stump, and Talat meets that with a free, whippy swing of his bat to drill it to the left of long-on
full and wide, carved hard, along the ground to deep point
shortish slower one outside off. Talat goes for the big swat over midwicket and misses
slower bouncer wide of off, Talat slashes and misses
yorker on off stump, jabbed to mid-off
another bouncer, over off stump, Talat ducks and lets it pass through to the keeper. Given wide on height
shortish outside off, steered down to third man
short ball close to off stump, right in his slot to pull, and he ends up pulling it in the air, straight to the man at deep midwicket. A wicket against the run of play for Quetta
back of a length close to off stump, steered to the right of third man
back of a length, slanting across to off stump, lets it come on and guides it to third man
back of a length, angling into leg stump - saw Talat looking to make himself room and followed him. Jabbed gently into the covers for one
length ball slanting across to a sixth-stump line. Takes a big step back into his own crease and slogs across the line, only manages a bottom edge down to fine leg
back of a length outside off. Goes for an angled-bat jab and ends up getting an inside-edge to short fine leg

and he serves one up right in his slot. Full, but not full enough to deny him elevation, and angling into off stump. Clears his front leg and swings cleanly through the line to clear the man at long-on

digs this in short and angles it across the right-hander. Extra bounce forces him off his feet as he tries to slash over point. Ends up hitting the high part of the bat and looping over the covers. Falls safely beyond the inner ring, though
digs in a bouncer, right at Asif's left shoulder, and he's late on the pull. Goes high in the air, but falls to ground beyond square leg, beyond the reach of Pietersen turning around and chasing back
bang, Asif finishes it in style. Full, on leg stump, and he clears his front leg and sends another sweetly timed lofted hit soaring waaaaay over long-on
